Business_Process_Parameters.description: When set to "true" or "1", the business process is automatically processed. This means that all approvals will be automatically approved in the system, all reviews and to-do's will be automatically by-passed, and all notifications will be automatically suppressed.

Indicates the transaction should process to completion before the response is generated.  Note: All < v12 operations will process with Run_Now = True for backwards compatibility but please review this setting in your environment for performance conditions.

Enforces all validation conditions defined on the initiation step.  If any condition is true, the validation error blocks the step from exiting and a business process event isn't created. The attribute is currently not available for use. It will be generally available for all web services in a future release.

validation.validation: Discard on Exit Validation Error

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Free form comment regarding the business process.

validation.validation: This Business Process has been configured to disable comment. Please remove the comment or change the setting in the Business Process Policy or tenant setup.

WorkerObject.description: Display information used to describe an instance of an object. This 'optional' information is for outbound descriptive purposes only and is not processed on inbound Workday Web Services requests.

WorkerObjectID.description: The unique identifier type. Each "ID" for an instance of an object contains a type and a value. A single instance of an object can have multiple "ID" but only a single "ID" per "type".  Some "types" require a reference to a parent instance.

WorkerObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

Business_Process_Comment_Data.description: Default the Person making the comment to the processing person if not submitted via the web service.

Business_Process_Parameters.description: Captures a comment for the Business Process.

description: Container for the processing options for a business process. If no options are submitted (or the options are submitted as 'false') then the business process is simply initiated as if it where submitted on-line with approvals, reviews, notifications and to-do's in place. If the Initiator is an Integration System User, any validations you configured on the Initiation step are ignored.

Specify 1 or more courses in the alternate course set.
For a Not Required override, ensure that you don't specify any alternate courses.

Assign_Course_Override_Data.description: The registration to be assigned to the requirement.
The units that should be applied for the academic progress satisfiable.
If specified, allows passing registrations that do not meet the grade requirement for the academic requirement.

Academic_Requirement_Override_Data.description: Data related to the assign course to requirement override type.

validation.validation: To submit an Assign Course to Requirement override, ensure that each registration is used only once.
Ensure that the units to apply don't exceed the registration units.
To specify Ignore Grade, ensure that the academic requirement to override uses an eligibility rule with a grade component specified.

Ensure that the registrations to assign to the academic requirement are either in progress or completed with a grade that is specified on the academic requirement. To assign a registration with a grade that doesn’t match the grade specified on the academic requirement, specify Ignore Grade.
To specify Ignore Grade when overriding an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule, ensure that the required course is in a subrule with a grade component specified.

Course_DefinitionObject.description: Contains a unique identifier for an instance of an object.

validation.validation: Specify a Course to Add Reference only when submitting an Add Course override type.
If the academic requirement contains a Combination eligibility rule, specify a Student Eligibility Rule on the Add Course to Combination Academic Requirement Data.
You can't specify a course to add that's already in use for the academic requirement.

validation.validation: Ensure that the course you specify is valid for the student.

Ensure that the units to apply don't exceed the registration units.

Ensure that the registrations to assign to the academic requirement are either in progress or completed with a grade that is specified on the academic requirement. To assign a registration with a grade that doesn’t match the grade specified on the academic requirement, specify Ignore Grade.
To specify Ignore Grade when overriding an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule, ensure that the required course is in a subrule with a grade component specified.

validation.validation: Ensure that the registrations to apply are either in progress or completed with a grade that is specified on the academic requirement.
To apply units, ensure that the eligibility rule type is Unit Requirement.
Ensure that the eligibility rule type is either a Course Requirement or a Unit Requirement.

Specify the Add Course to Combination Academic Requirement Data only when submitting an Add Course override type for an academic requirement with a Combination eligibility rule.

You can't specify a course to add that's already in use for the academic requirement.
Ensure that the course you specify is valid for the student.

To add courses, ensure that the academic requirement uses an eligibility rule that has at least 1 course.

You can specify the Adjust Units Override Data only for the Adjust Units override type.

Adjust_Course_Count_Override_Data.description: The eligibility rule for the Adjust Course Count override.
The new number of courses for the eligibility rule.

Academic_Requirement_Override_Data.description: Data related to the Adjust Course Count override type.

validation.validation: You can specify the Adjust Course Count Override Data only for the Adjust Course Count override type.
To submit an Adjust Course Count override, specify the Adjust Course Count Override Data.
Submit either Student Reference or Academic Record Reference.
Specify an Academic Record Reference. If you're using a version before v30.0 of the web service operation, update to the latest version.
You can't submit this override because the student has a pending Waive Requirement override on this academic requirement.
You can't submit this override because the academic requirement is already waived for the student.
Ensure that the academic requirement uses a Unit Requirement type eligibility rule.
To specify registrations, use the Assign Course to Requirement override type.
To specify courses, use the Substitute Course override type.
To add courses, ensure that the academic requirement uses an eligibility rule that has at least 1 course.
To specify eligibility rules, ensure that the academic requirement uses a combination eligibility rule.
Specify an eligibility rule only once when you override an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule.
Specify only eligibility rules that are in the combination eligibility rule that the academic requirement uses.
You can't waive an academic requirement when the student has either a pending or an approved override already on the requirement.
Specify an eligibility rule only once when you use the Add Course override type for an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule.
To submit an Add Course override, specify the Add Course Override Data or Add Course to Eligibility Rule Data.
For an Assign Course to Requirement override, specify course registrations to apply.
Specify an eligibility rule only once when you override an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule.
To submit an Adjust Units override, ensure that the academic requirement uses either a unit requirement or a combination with at least 1 unit requirement eligibility rule.
The specified student has been merged with another student record. Specify the merged student instead.
Specify an eligibility rule only once when you override an academic requirement that uses a combination eligibility rule.

To use the Adjust Course Count override, ensure that the academic requirement uses a Course Requirement type or a Combination with at least 1 Course Requirement type eligibility rule. The eligibility rule must have a Selector of any.
To override an academic requirement that contains an accomplishment eligibility rule, specify the Override Type of Waive Requirement.
To override an academic requirement that contains an activity eligibility rule, specify the Override Type of Waive Requirement.
You can’t create or edit an academic requirement override until the in-progress business process ([OVERRIDE_TYPE]) completes.
